item.title: Transforming the WAN Into The Smart WAN
item.description:
People tend to think of WAN connections as basic channels for data, similar to how Senator Ted Stevens once described the internet. However, with the shift from on-site data centers to cloud-based systems, VoIP, and video streaming, our needs have outgrown this simple model. This is where the concept of a Smart WAN comes into play. Instead of treating all data equally, a Smart WAN prioritizes different types of data through a system called Class of Service (CoS)...

item.title: Why The Smart WAN Beats A Dumb Pipe
item.description:
Wide Area Networks (WANs) are traditionally built using “dumb pipes,” which are simple bandwidth connections between two points. These connections are efficient at their primary function: transferring data packets. However, as IT requirements become more complex, there’s a growing need for more intelligent solutions. This can be achieved by either enhancing your internal IT capabilities or outsourcing these needs as a service.
